title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested in Seaport during a BPD undercover operation.
Macean faces charges of human trafficking, commercial sex acts, and deriving support from prostitution.
The arrest operation was conducted by Boston Police Human Trafficking Unit and State Police.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston sees more daytime coyote sightings due to mating season from January to March.
MassWildlife advises keeping pets indoors and using noise and movement to deter coyotes.
Coyote attacks on humans are rare; fewer than 10 incidents in Massachusetts over the past 60 years.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton praised Patriots QB Drake Maye after previously criticizing him during the 2025 season.
Newton commended Maye's progress despite the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Drake Maye finished the season as the MVP runner-up, looking to improve after playoff struggles.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston College's James Hagens won the Beanpot MVP, contributing two goals and five points over the two-game tournament.
Bruins prospect Hagens, drafted 7th overall in 2025, has 31 points in 24 games during his sophomore season.
BC senior Andre Gasseau and sophomore Dean Letourneau, both Bruins prospects, scored critical goals in the Beanpot final.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis highlighted New England's appeal as a destination for free agents this offseason.
The Patriots have $42.7 million in cap space, with the potential to restructure contracts for more spending.
New England reached Super Bowl LX with a new coaching staff and players, boosting its desirability to free agents.

title: Sticker shock for a dealerâ€™s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader received a $1,200 dealership quote to replace a starter on a 2014 Honda Accord EX.
John Paul, AAA's Car Doctor, suggests a similar repair should cost around $925, accounting for parts and labor.
Dealerships can charge 30-36% more than independent shops, says John Paul, recommending AAA Approved Repair shops.

title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kristian Campbell is transitioning to play mostly in the outfield for the Red Sox in 2026.
Campbell struggled defensively at second base in 2025, prompting a move to the outfield.
Despite defensive issues, Campbell's offensive potential remains his key tool for MLB success.

title: Jayson Tatum remains noncommittal about returning this season for Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in practices with the Maine Celtics but remains noncommittal about returning this season.
Tatum, recovering from an Achilles tear, has been sidelined all season yet stays involved with the Celtics.
While progressing in rehab, Tatum is considering the impact of rejoining a successful team mid-season.

title: Mass. Education Secretary Patrick Tutwiler to step down in latest departure from Healey cabinet
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Patrick Tutwiler is stepping down as Massachusetts Education Secretary to lead Walker Therapeutic & Educational Programs.
Governor Maura Healey appointed Salem Schools Superintendent Stephen Zrike as the new Education Secretary starting next month.
Tutwiler opposed the removal of MCAS as a graduation requirement and prioritized early literacy initiatives during his tenure.

title: Drake Maye says marrying young was ‘one of the best things I’ve experienced in my life’
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye shared his positive experience of marrying young in an Instagram post during Super Bowl week.
Drake and Ann Michael Maye began dating in middle school and were married on June 21, 2025, in North Carolina.
Maye encourages teammates to consider marriage, highlighting personal stability amidst the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
